title: Israel unleashes fresh strikes across Iran; nuclear facility among targets — 10 key developments
content: A week into the Israel-Iran war, hundreds are dead amid intensifying strikes and missile attacks. Israel hit key military and nuclear sites in Tehran, while Iran retaliated, including with a cluster bomb strike on an Israeli hospital. President Trump said he’ll decide within two weeks on possible US military involvement. Talks in Geneva offer a diplomatic opening, but fears of wider regional escalation continue to grow, with tensions at boiling point.

title: Air India cancels seven flights; cites 'maintenance and operational reasons'
content: Air India has cancelled seven flights, including four international and three domestic routes, citing "enhanced maintenance and operational reasons."

title: '60 fighter jets in action': How Israel pulled off overnight airstrikes on Iran
content: Israeli Defense Forces conducted extensive strikes on Iranian military targets, including the Organization of Defensive Innovation and Research (SPND), linked to Iran's nuclear program. The operation involved over 60 fighter jets targeting missile manufacturing facilities and the SPND headquarters. These strikes are part of an escalating conflict, prompting diplomatic efforts from European officials as the US considers involvement.

title: Bihar polls: Cong ramps up quota pitch ahead of PM Modi's visit
content: As PM Modi inaugurates development projects in Bihar, Congress criticizes the NDA government's handling of the proposed 65% reservation for marginalized communities. Jairam Ramesh suggests legislative measures, including constitutional amendments and implementing Article 15(5), to bypass legal hurdles and ensure the reservation's implementation. Congress plans to raise these social justice issues in the upcoming Parliament session.

title: Watch: Karun Nair makes massive revelation ahead of IND vs ENG 1st Test – 'I’m ready to ...'
content: Karun Nair's unwavering determination to represent India in Test cricket fueled his daily purpose after being away from the spotlight since 2017. His comeback against England, the same opponent he last faced, feels like a full circle moment.

title: Amazon's ultimatum: Company tells employees to choose - 30 days to ... or resign in 60 days
content: Amazon is requiring numerous corporate employees to relocate to major hubs like Seattle and Arlington, creating anxiety amidst job insecurity and AI-driven workforce reductions. Affected employees face short deadlines to decide, with no severance offered for those who resign instead of moving. This relocation push intensifies Amazon's in-office requirements and aligns with warnings of upcoming AI-related layoffs.

title: US pulls out nearly 40 jets from Qatar airbase; here's why
content: Satellite images reveal a significant reduction in US military aircraft at Qatar's Al Udeid Air Base, potentially as a precaution against Iranian strikes amid escalating tensions. Nearly 40 aircraft dwindled to just three between June 5 and June 19. The US embassy has restricted base access, urging vigilance.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 rallies above 25,000; BSE Sensex up over 700 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on Friday. While Nifty50 went above 25,000, BSE Sensex was up over 700 points.

title: AI is your intern today: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman to software engineers; but soon …
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman envisions AI evolving from an 'intern' to a seasoned software engineer, potentially revolutionizing coding roles. He anticipates AI agents tackling complex business problems and discovering new knowledge soon. While this shift demands software engineers focus on AI management and innovation, concerns arise about AI's impact on employment, with predictions of significant job displacement in white-collar sectors.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Winning a Test series much bigger than winning IPL' — Gill's bold claim
content: Shubman Gill will captain India in the upcoming Test series against England. He values winning this series more than an IPL title. Gill emphasizes the importance of Test cricket and building a legacy. He acknowledges the rarity of captaining in England. The series is crucial for defining his captaincy. All eyes are on Gill as he leads a new era.

title: 'Son's wedding cancelled': Netanyahu shares 'personal cost' of war with Iran
content: Amidst the ongoing Israeli-Iranian conflict, Prime Minister Netanyahu's comparison to the London Blitz and mention of his son's postponed wedding drew criticism. This followed Iranian missile strikes, including one hitting Soroka Medical Center, injuring many. Israel retaliated with airstrikes deep into Iran.

title: Chinese hackers target Russian agencies for war secrets: Report
content: Cybersecurity experts have uncovered that state-backed Chinese groups have been infiltrating Russian networks since the beginning of the Ukraine conflict, all in pursuit of sensitive military data. Although the two nations maintain a 'no-limits' partnership, a leaked FSB document indicates Russia's increasing unease regarding Chinese surveillance activities, even categorizing China as a potential adversary.

title: Narayana Murthy on future of India’s tech talent; says our programmers will …
content: nfosys founder NR Narayana Murthy dismisses AI job elimination fears, arguing technology creates new employment opportunities. Citing banking sector's 40-50x job growth post-computerization, he believes AI will enhance productivity and enable programmers to solve complex problems, transforming rather than replacing the workforce in India's IT industry.

title: Thailand crisis: PM Paetongtarn battles to save govt after leaked call
content: Thai PM Paetongtarn Shinawatra faces a political crisis after a leaked call with Cambodia's Hun Sen, where she called a military commander her "opponent." This sparked outrage, leading to a key ally's exit and a razor-thin majority. Paetongtarn apologized and will meet the commander to ease tensions.

title: Indian Navy Agniveer SSR/MR result declared; stage-II admit cards released - Details
content: The Indian Navy has announced the Agniveer SSR/MR Result 2025 on June 19, for the written exam held in May. Candidates can check their results on agniveernavy.cdac.in using their registered credentials. Shortlisted candidates will proceed to Stage-II, commencing June 30, involving a Physical Fitness Test and Medical Examination, as detailed on their admit cards.

title: Brandon Aiyuk sends clear message to San Francisco 49ers
content: Kansas City Chiefs may target Brandon Aiyuk before the 2025 season. Aiyuk seeks a long-term deal, around $23 million annually. This move could boost the Chiefs' offense and aid Patrick Mahomes. Aiyuk hinted at leaving the 49ers. Experts suggest the Chiefs will pursue Aiyuk if he is available. Mahomes has been training with young receivers.

title: Shocker! Aus drop star batter after WTC final defeat against SA
content: Australia have dropped Marnus Labuschagne for the first Test against the West Indies, as announced by selector George Bailey. Steve Smith will also miss the match due to a finger injury sustained during the World Test Championship final. Labuschagne's recent form has been poor, averaging 24.7 in his last 16 matches.

title: Dwyane Wade's wife Gabrielle Union shows support for Victoria Monét in heartfelt post
content: Gabrielle Union is set to moderate Victoria Monét's book launch event in Los Angeles for her new children's book, 'Everywhere You Are.' Union reposted Monét's announcement on Instagram, expressing her support for the book, which explores themes of love and connection. The event promises a discussion and Q&A session, with both mothers and authors sharing their insights.

title: ‘Keep my bag or I’ll crash plane’: AI flight delayed as doc threatens crew
content: An Ayurvedic doctor, Vyas Hiral Mohanbhai, was arrested in Bengaluru after causing a disturbance on an Air India flight to Surat. She allegedly threatened to crash the aircraft when crew members objected to her placing baggage in a restricted area. Mohanbhai bypassed check-in, insisting on carrying both bags onboard, leading to a two-hour flight delay and a security concern.

title: Wayne Gretzky opens up about how his father tried to stop nickname from sticking
content: Wayne Gretzky's iconic nickname, 'The Great One,' faced initial resistance from his father, Walter. Despite concerns about pressure, the name stuck as Gretzky dominated youth hockey. He later embraced it, exceeding expectations with a record-breaking NHL career. Gretzky also commented on the Edmonton Oilers' recent loss to the Florida Panthers. His journey reflects humility, brilliance, and lasting greatness in hockey.

title: Messi does it again! Inter Miami make history in Club World Cup - Watch
content: Inter Miami, co-owned by David Beckham, achieved a stunning 2-1 victory over Porto in the Club World Cup, fueled by Lionel Messi's exceptional free-kick. After Porto's early lead, Segovia equalised before Messi's decisive goal. This win marks a historic moment as the first MLS team to defeat European opposition in competitive play.

title: Family feud: Dayanidhi Maran accuses brother Kalanithi of fraud; sends legal notice
content: Dayanidhi Maran has accused his brother Kalanithi Maran of illegally transferring Sun TV group shares worth thousands of crore. The legal notice alleges Kalanithi amassed Rs 5,926 crore in dividends until 2023 and Rs 455 crore in 2024 through fraudulent means. Dayanidhi threatens legal action, demanding the restoration of the company's original ownership structure from 2003.

title: A game-changer in cancer research? Scientists reprogram tumour cells without chemo
content: South Korean researchers at KAIST developed a new cancer therapy. It reprograms cancer cells into normal cells without chemotherapy or radiation. The AI-powered tool, BENEIN, maps and silences specific genes. Lab tests showed promising results in colon cancer cells and mice. This innovative approach offers hope for safer, personalized cancer treatments. Further research is needed before human trials can begin.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for June 20, 2025 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests investor sentiment is fragile due to geopolitical tensions and crude price rallies. Nifty is range-bound between 24,400-25,200, while Bank Nifty consolidates around 56,000. Top stock picks are Paras Defence and Space Technologies, and Thirumalai Chemicals, both with a target return of 10% over three months.

title: Cash-at-home case: Probe panel junks theories offered by Varma in his defence; what report said
content: An inquiry committee has rejected Justice Varma's explanations regarding the cash found at his residence, dismissing claims of planted evidence and arson. The panel's report highlighted Varma's control over the premises and questioned his conduct following the discovery. Evidence and witness statements suggest a breach of public trust, potentially leading to removal proceedings.

title: 'Selectors shouldn't repeat the mistake': Kaif warns Gambhir
content: As India prepares for the first Test against England, the crucial No. 3 position is under scrutiny with Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma absent. Sai Sudharsan's IPL form puts him in contention, but Abhimanyu Easwaran's extensive domestic record presents a strong case. Mohammad Kaif urges selectors to respect Easwaran's experience, cautioning against overlooking proven performers like Sarfaraz Khan.

title: Exclusive | If Bumrah is even 75–80% fit, I’d ...: Ex-England captain Gower
content: David Gower discusses the upcoming England-India Test series, highlighting Shubman Gill's captaincy challenges and Jasprit Bumrah's crucial role. Gower emphasizes the importance of Bumrah's strategic deployment due to workload management. He acknowledges India's transition period with experienced players like KL Rahul stepping up, while favoring England to win the series 3-1 due to home advantage and India's vulnerabilities.

title: Shukla's Axiom 4 launch delayed again; Nasa cites safety checks; new date soon
content: Nasa has delayed the Axiom Mission 4 launch to the ISS, which includes Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, due to the need for further assessment of recent repairs on the Zvezda service module. Engineers are ensuring the space station is fully prepared to support the new crew, which also includes astronauts from Poland and Hungary.

title: PM Modi to visit Bihar, Odisha, and Andhra Pradesh- What's on his agenda?
content: Prime Minister Modi is embarking on a two-day tour across Bihar, Odisha, and Visakhapatnam, commencing Friday. He will inaugurate development projects, including railway lines and sewage treatment plants, and launch new train services. In Odisha, projects worth over Rs 18,600 crore will be initiated.

title: Amid escalating conflict, India to extend Op Sindhu to Israel as well
content: Amid escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, the Indian government has initiated evacuation plans for Indian nationals in Israel, facilitating their departure via land borders followed by air travel to India. Simultaneously, 'Operation Sindhu' is underway to evacuate Indians from Iran, with a special flight already bringing 110 students back from Urmia Medical University.

title: IND vs ENG: For Shubman Gill the captain to thrive, the batter must fire
content: On the eve of his first Test as India captain, Shubman Gill immersed himself in a marathon net session at Headingley, showcasing sharp focus on his batting. Now slotted at No. 4, Gill aims to assert himself as a dependable run-scorer in the post-Kohli era. While captaincy talk dominates, Gill remains clear: batting form is key to leading well.

title: Trump hosts Juventus: Poses awkward question; GM answers diplomatically
content: Juventus squad visited the White House before their FIFA Club World Cup game. Donald Trump's unexpected question about women joining the team stunned the players. Juventus General Manager responded diplomatically. Despite the awkward moment, Juventus defeated Al Ain 5–0 in their first match. Randal Kolo Muani and Francisco Conceição scored twice. The team will face Wydad AC next.

title: Shashi Tharoor admits differences with party brass, but refuses to discuss them in public
content: Shashi Tharoor, a Congress MP, has publicly acknowledged disagreements with certain party leaders, refraining from elaborating due to the Nilambur bypoll. This admission follows his praise for the NDA government's Operation Sindoor and participation in an all-party delegation against terror, reportedly causing discomfort within the Congress leadership.

title: India bleeds Pak dry: Water at ‘dead’ levels; bigger Indus plans - top points
content: Following the Indus Waters Treaty suspension, India is optimizing the Indus river system, looking to construct a 113-km canal to redirect water to Punjab, Haryana, and Rajasthan. This inter-basin transfer aims to maximize water usage from eastern rivers and fully utilize India's share of western rivers, potentially limiting Pakistan's water access.

title: Will the US join Israel's strike on Iran? Here's what White House answered
content: President Trump will decide within two weeks whether the US will join Israel's military actions against Iran, amidst ongoing speculation. He acknowledged a 'substantial' chance for negotiations to peacefully resolve the conflict. This declaration offers a diplomatic window, despite Trump's earlier strong statements.

title: Akshay Kumar's ‘Housefull 5’ slows down as ‘Sitare Zameen Par’ hits cinemas
content: Akshay Kumar's Housefull 5, after a strong start, sees a dip in its third week. The movie earned Rs 167.90 crore in 14 days. Aamir Khan's Sitare Zameen Par released on June 20. The film has promising advance bookings, earning Rs 3.31 crore. This new release could affect Housefull 5's box office performance.

title: Trump-Munir meeting signals strategic calculations amid regional tensions
content: A White House meeting between President Trump and Field Marshal Asim Munir has ignited speculation about a potential US-Pakistan realignment. Discussions centered on counter-terrorism, trade, and regional stability, with Trump reportedly seeking Pakistan's assistance regarding Iran in exchange for economic and military support. This move could reshape South Asia's power dynamics, impacting India's regional influence.

title: Post stampede, Karnataka drafts tough crowd-control bill
content: Following a tragic stampede during IPL victory celebrations, the Karnataka government has drafted a bill to hold event organizers accountable for crowd management. The proposed legislation includes jail time and fines for safety violations, granting authorities broad powers to regulate events.

title: Mehul Choksi sues India in UK high court for ‘kidnapping him’ in Antigua
content: Mehul Choksi is suing the Indian government and five individuals in London's High Court, alleging his kidnapping from Antigua in 2021 was orchestrated by India's intelligence agency, R&AW, as part of a honeytrap plot to extradite him.

title: Telangana village on 'suicide watch' saves 300 lives in 3 years
content: Residents of Yamcha, a village near Nizamabad, Telangana, have bravely prevented over 300 suicide attempts in the past three years, primarily at the Basara bridge, a known suicide hotspot. The villagers, skilled swimmers, vigilantly monitor the river, especially during the monsoon, rescuing individuals driven to desperation by debt and family issues.

title: Uddhav already politically dead, declares Shinde
content: At Shiv Sena's foundation day event, Eknath Shinde attacked Uddhav Thackeray for alleged BMC corruption and abandoning Bal Thackeray's ideology. Shinde questioned Thackeray's actions regarding Marathi people in Mumbai, accusing him of prioritizing money over their welfare.

title: Crashed plane was 'well-maintained', says Air India CEO
content: A well-maintained Air India Boeing 787 Dreamliner (VT-ANB) crashed in Ahmedabad last Thursday, killing 241 onboard and 34 on the ground. Despite regular monitoring and recent engine overhauls, the cause remains unknown. Air India MD & CEO Campbell Wilson expressed sorrow and commitment to supporting families and investigations.

title: Scores of Indians stranded in Iran, Israel; anxiety stalks kin
content: Amid escalating conflict between Iran and Israel, numerous Indian nationals, including students and pilgrims, are stranded, facing uncertain and risky returns. Indian embassies are coordinating evacuations, yet communication with some individuals remains difficult, causing immense distress to families back in India. Efforts are underway to provide assistance and facilitate their safe passage through neighboring countries.

title: Railways caps wait-list tickets at 25% of train's capacity
content: Indian Railways has initiated a policy shift by capping wait-listed tickets to a maximum of 25% of available berths in each class, aiming to reduce passenger uncertainty and overcrowding. This decision, implemented following a Railway Board circular, allows zonal railways to determine waitlist limits based on booking and cancellation patterns.

title: Pacers riding high, not celebrating Game 6 rout
content: The Pacers gave their home crowd plenty to cheer about in Thursday night's blowout win, including a highlight-reel dunk by Pascal Siakam, but they were in no mood to celebrate with Game 7 around the corner.

title: For OKC, no excuses after 'uncharacteristic' dud
content: The Thunder turned in a clunker of an NBA Finals performance Thursday night and know they will have to be a lot better in Game 7.

title: Dodgers ask feds to leave; team delays initiatives
content: The Dodgers, who denied federal immigration agents access to the stadium's parking lot, have postponed plans to unveil initiatives to assist immigrant communities.

title: Rays' Bigge hit by foul ball in dugout, carted off
content: Rays pitcher Hunter Bigge was carted off the field in a frightening scene Thursday night after he was struck by a foul ball in the dugout.

title: Pirates reliever swipes at fan he says crossed line
content: Pittsburgh's Dennis Santana was involved in an altercation with a fan he said "crossed the line a few times" Thursday night in Detroit.

title: U.S. beats Saudis, clinches Gold Cup knockouts
content: Defender Chris Richards scored with a flick of the ball off a second-half free kick to lift the United States to a 1-0 win over Saudi Arabia on Thursday night, sending the Americans on to the Concacaf Gold Cup quarterfinals.

title: Liberty C Jones reinjures ankle on awkward fall
content: Liberty center Jonquel Jones reinjured the ankle that recently caused her to miss two games, and she had to be helped off the court during Thursday's loss to the Mercury.

title: Oregon lands No. 1-rated safety, nephew of Kobe
content: Four-star prospect Jett Washington, ESPN's No. 1 safety in the 2026 class, announced his commitment to Oregon over Alabama and USC on Thursday night.

title: 🌟  Inside the rise of MLB's next superstar
content: From flag football to Wrigley Field, PCA has been turning heads with his talent, energy and personality since he was a kid.

title: 'The Lakers can finally be run like a real business': Leaguewide reaction to the stunning sale
content: The Lakers have spent decades lagging behind other NBA teams in ways known -- and not. This sale presents a massive opportunity for them to catch up -- and expedite their chase for title No. 18.

title: Barnwell picks the NFL's top luxuries: The best players at 11 specialized roles
content: Gadget player, slot cornerback, swing tackle, backup quarterback -- these players are the best at their very specific roles.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Can anyone unseat the Tigers at No. 1?
content: With a third week in a row atop our list, Detroit becomes the team with the most consecutive weeks at No. 1 in 2025.

title: Richards saves the day for the USMNT on a night when the frontline couldn't
content: The United States have officially qualified for the quarterfinals of the Gold Cup, but the performances from the attacking players will need to improve.

title: Club World Cup updates: Messi magic helps Inter Miami to famous win vs. Porto
content: Lionel Messi did what he normally does -- the incredible -- as Inter Miami stunned Porto to boost their chances of a place in the last-16. Here's what you need to know from Thursday, June 19 in the Club World Cup.

title: Carlton Dotson's parole surprise and the aftermath of a 2003 murder
content: Carlton Dotson is no longer behind bars, while a Baylor coaching whistleblower is now a prison warden

title: Wings' Bueckers finding her footing in rookie season of ups and downs
content: The No. 1 draft pick is looking increasingly confident and comfortable as a pro. Will it translate to more wins?

title: MLB mock draft 2.0: Kiley McDaniel predicts the first 40 picks
content: The Men's College World Series is bringing the top of next month's draft into better focus, starting with a new No. 1 pick.

title: Trade Giannis or build around him? 8 deals the Bucks should consider
content: Milwaukee could choose to retool its roster this summer. Will the two-time MVP still be a Buck when the dust settles?

title: The NBA draft talent pipeline (once again) runs through college basketball
content: After taking a backseat to other NBA developmental paths, college basketball seems to be reemerging at the top.

title: Updated NBA mock draft with movement in the top 10: How we see Rounds 1 and 2
content: With the draft a week away, Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo share the latest intel from around the league.

title: Messi ignites Miami's CWC with stunning winner
content: Lionel Messi scored his first goal of the expanded Club World Cup on Thursday with a patented free kick, giving Inter Miami a historic 2-1 win over Portugal's FC Porto.

title: Brazil's Botafogo upset UCL champs PSG at CWC
content: Igor Jesus scored a first-half goal, leading Botafogo to a stunning 1-0 win over the reigning European champions Paris Saint-Germain in the Club World Cup on Thursday in Pasadena, California.

title: Bayern, Kompany wary of 'dangerous' Boca
content: Bayern Munich will have no room for complacency when they face Argentina's Boca Juniors in their second Group C match, the German club's coach Vincent Kompany said on Thursday.

title: Manchester City fined £1m for delayed kickoffs
content: Manchester City have been fined more than £1 million by the Premier League for breaching the rules around delayed kickoffs and restarts nine times last season, England's top-flight league said on Thursday.

title: Source: Bayer in talks to sign Liverpool's Quansah
content: Bayer Leverkusen are in talks with Liverpool over a deal to sign defender Jarell Quansah, a source told ESPN.

title: Canada coach Marsch faces fresh Concacaf probe
content: The Canadian Soccer Association and head coach Jesse Marsch are under investigation by Concacaf over claims of rules violations and the use of offensive language.

title: Aké: Don't bring CWC's individual walkouts to Prem
content: Nathan Aké has told the Premier League to resist the temptation to copy the individual pre-game walkouts that have been introduced at the Club World Cup.

title: Premier League 2025-26 fixtures: Arsenal's horror start, all the big games
content: The fixtures for the 2025-26 Premier League season are out! Which title contenders have the toughest start and what could shape the race for the trophy?

title: Euro 2025 breakout stars: Which U21 players will shine?
content: Euro 2025 will offer some young players the chance to shine, and there are a number of impressive U21 stars looking to do just that.

title: Fantasy football: Values for CMC, Tyreek and more top storylines for 2025
content: Mike Clay, Daniel Dopp and Field Yates enjoy a robust conversation about the topics that fascinate them most heading into this fantasy season.

title: Expert picks, best bets for UFC Fight Night and PFL semifinals
content: Din Thomas and Anthony Smith pick the main event for UFC from Azerbaijan, and Ian Parker provides betting advice for UFC and PFL events this week.

title: KPMG Women's PGA Championship: From Nelly Korda to Lydia Ko's record chase, storylines to watch
content: The third major of the LPGA Tour season starts Thursday with Korda looking to get back in the winner's circle and Ko trying to add to her impressive winnings.

title: Spaun's stunning U.S. Open victory shakes up Ryder Cup race, plus favorites at The Open
content: Who will be the favorites in The Open? Will J.J. Spaun's unlikely victory propel him to more wins? With the U.S. Open finished, we look ahead in the 2025 season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern high on Barcola, Leão, Williams
content: Bayern Munich are keeping tabs on Bradley Barcola, among other wingers. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Debunking the 'Man United tax' myth
content: Transfer chiefs have complained for years, but it's on the club to stop paying over the odds for players.

title: Pranav Adani Explains Think Tank CRF's Role In Journey Towards Viksit Bharat
content: Adani Enterprises Director Pranav Adani congratulated the think tank Chintan Research Foundation (CRF) on celebrating its Foundation Day on Thursday, and expressed hope that the CRF will be a key motivator in shaping policies of India.

title: Satellite Images Show Massive Damage To Iran's Arak Nuclear Facility
content: Satellite pictures from Maxar Technologies, dated June 19, confirm that Israel's recent airstrike caused substantial structural damage to Iran's heavy water reactor facility at Arak, also known as Khondab, roughly 250 kilometres southwest of Tehran.

title: Iran's Arak Reactor, Hit By Israeli Strike, Was Part Of Tehran's Nuclear Deal
content: Much of the focus on Iran's nuclear program has been on Tehran's enrichment of uranium, but experts also keep a close watch on the Islamic Republic's Arak heavy water reactor.

title: Karnataka Man Strangles Pregnant Wife To Death, Then Kills Self
content: Police suspect that a domestic issue led to the alleged murder-suicide. However, a detailed investigation is underway to ascertain the exact cause.

title: How Can A Corrupt Public Official Be Allowed To Resume Duty, Asks Top Court
content: A government official convicted in a corruption case should not be allowed to rejoin service till he or she is exonerated, the Supreme Court said on Thursday.

title: PM Modi To Launch Rs 5,700 Crore Development Projects In Bihar Today
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit the Siwan district of Bihar on Friday, where he will inaugurate and lay the foundation stone of multiple infrastructure and development projects worth Rs 5,700 crore.

title: Israel-Iran Attacks Live Updates: Russia Warns Of 'Chernobyl-Like' Catastrophe If Israel Attacks Nuclear Power Plant
content: Israel-Iran Attacks Live Updates: Russia has warned Israel against striking Iran's Bushehr nuclear power plant, saying "it will be a catastrophe comparable to Chernobyl".

title: Shubhanshu Shukla's Space Mission Postponed Again, No New Date In Sight
content: Better safe than sorry, this is what NASA and its partners are practising for their much awaited launch of Axiom Mission 4 (Ax-4), which is set to carry Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla to space.

title: Body Of Air India Crew Member Lamnunthem Singson Reaches Manipur, Thousands Bid Her Farewell
content: Lamnunthem Singson was among the 241 passengers and crew aboard Air India Flight AI 171, which crashed just seconds after takeoff.

title: Trump To Make Iran Decision "Within 2 Weeks", Says White House: 10 Points
content: The White House said on Thursday that US President Donald Trump will decide whether to get involved in the Israel-Iran conflict in the next two weeks. Russia has warned Israel against striking Iran's Bushehr nuclear power plant.

title: Why Iranian Activists Are Unwilling To Protest Against Khamenei Regime
content: Iran's fragmented opposition groups think their moment may be close at hand, but activists involved in previous bouts of protest say they are unwilling to unleash mass unrest, even against a system they hate, with their nation under attack.

title: NIA Court Refuses Activist Gautam Navlakha Permission To Live In Delhi
content: A court on Thursday denied activist Gautam Navlakha, an accused in the Elgar Parishad-Maoist links case, the permission to live in Delhi.

title: Netanyahu Says Fall Of Iran's Leadership Not A Goal But Could Be A Result
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Thursday that the change or fall of Iran's leadership was not a goal of Israel's attacks but could be a result.

title: US Military Jets No Longer Visible At Qatar Base, Show Satellite Images
content: Dozens of US aircraft are no longer on the tarmac at a major US base in Qatar, satellite images show -- a possible move to shield them from eventual Iranian air strikes, as Washington weighs whether to intervene in Tehran's conflict with Israel.

title: Karnataka Increases Muslim Housing Quota, BJP Calls It "Unconstitutional"
content: The Karnataka government's decision to increase reservation for minority communities under housing schemes has sparked strong criticism from the BJP. State party president Vijayendra Yediyurappa has called it "unconstitutional".

title: Israel-Iran Attacks Live Updates: "Extremely Dangerous": Russia Warns US Against 'Military Intervention' In Iran-Israel War
content: Moreover, Tel Aviv's residential buildings were hit by another missile. Around 40 people were wounded in the attacks, according to Israel's Magen David Adom rescue service.

title: Air India Crash: 215 DNA Matches Found, 198 Bodies Handed Over To Families
content: Ahmedabad Civil Hospital Superintendent Rakesh Joshi on Thursday said that 215 DNA samples have been matched, and the mortal remains of 198 deceased in the Air India AI-171 plane crash have been handed over to their respective families.

title: Jaipur Airport Receives Hoax Bomb Threat
content: Jaipur Airport received a bomb threat on Thursday, which was later confirmed to be a hoax, police said.

title: Hezbollah Vows "All Forms Of Support" To Iran Amid Conflict With Israel
content: Hezbollah leader Sheikh Naim Qassem has pledged "all forms of support" to Iran in its fight against Israel and the United States, saying Iran's nuclear program is peaceful and aims to serve its people, The Jerusalem Post reported.

title: PLL Power Rankings ahead of Week 4: Who's the new No. 1?
content: four teams are 2-1, while the other four are 1-2 . the redwoods jump into a top spot after a 12-11 win over California last week . but the team is winning just 38% of their faceoffs and their offense isn't humming .

title: Woman Maoist killed in encounter with security personnel in Chhattisgarh’s Kanker
content: The operation was launched between Amatola and Kalpar villages based on inputs about the presence of the members of the banned Maoist organisation on the other side of the Kotri river

title: Elgar case: Court refuses Gautam Navlakha permission to live in Delhi
content: "Granting permission to the accused to travel beyond the jurisdiction of the court is a different thing and allowing him to reside permanently beyond the jurisdiction of the court is an entirely different thing," the court said.

title: Several Air India flights cancelled due to maintenance, bad weather
content: For all the cancellations, Air India has offered full refunds or free rescheduling and is helping passengers with alternate travel plans.

title: First Indian epigraphical reference to Halley’s comet found in 15th century copper plate inscription in Mallikarjunaswamy temple in Srisailam
content: The inscription records a grant made by the Vijayanagara ruler Mallikarjuna to a Vedic scholar on Śaka 1378, Dhātru Āshāḍha ba. 11, corresponding to Monday, June 28, 1456 CE

title: Security forces arrest seven militants in Manipur
content: Nearly seven militants in Manipur from various proscribed outfits arrested, seizing arms and ammunition in search operations

title: Air India warned by DGCA for flying Airbus planes with unchecked escape slides
content: The airline was warned over delayed checks on three planes; some Air India aircraft also had outdated registration paperwork

title: Postal services disruption on June 21 due to software upgradation in Bengaluru
content: Despite the disruption, essential postal services will remain available at selected offices such as HAL Sub Post Office, Jalahalli Sub Post Office and Basavanagudi Head Post Office

title: Nalini Atul takes charge as KKRDB secretary Kalyana Karnataka Region Development Board
content: His past assignments include serving as CEO of the Raichur Zilla Panchayat, Chairperson of the Karnataka School Examination and Assessment Board, and Controller of Examinations for KPSC

title: Govt to meet stakeholders to assess impact of Iran-Israel conflict on India’s trade
content: Exporters have stated that the war, if escalated further, would impact world trade and push both air and sea freight rates

title: HAL and Safran to produce forged parts for LEAP engines
content: HAL aims to support the strong growth of the Indian aerospace market and ensure the ramp-up of LEAP engines powering single-aisle civil aircraft

title: Sun TV shares fall 4%, after MP  Dayanidhi Maran’s legal notice to Kalanithi Maran
content: The legal notice to Kalanithi Maran and his wife Kavery Kalanithi and others raised a dispute in share transactions which took place in 2003, reflecting a family dispute between the brothers.

title: Maharashtra govt reconstitutes committee to resolve border dispute with Karnataka
content: The committee has now been reconstituted following the formation of the new government, with Mr. Fadnavis as the CM, after last year’s assembly polls

title: Honeymoon murder: Victim’s kin seek detailed questioning of Sonam Raghuvanshi to know ‘complete truth’
content: Sonam and four other accused in the case must be brought to Indore for a thorough investigation to uncover the “complete truth” behind the murder

title: Telangana HC notices to Chief Secretary, Naveen Mittal in octogenarian’s pleas
content: Meanwhile, the trial court passed an order keeping in abeyance the action of taking cognisance of the charges against the IAS officer and others

title: 70 protesters detained outside U.S. Consulate in Hyderabad
content: The protest was held to condemn the U.S. government’s support for Israeli military operations in Iran

title: Visakhapatnam all decked up for International Yoga Day celebrations
content: Scores of workers have been working tirelessly for the mega event; 28-km Beach Road stretch is being beautified;  2,500 sanitation workers engaged

title: Sickle Cell patients growing in tribal pockets of undivided Visakhapatnam district, says expert
content: An estimated 1% of the total population has SCD, and 4% are carriers of the sickle cell trait, says Associate Professor in Central Tribal University

title: Why India should address its propulsion gap
content: Is India overly reliant on imported engines? What happened to the HF-24 Marut, India’s first indigenously designed fighter jet? Why has the Kaveri engine project not been able to come to fruition? How is India affected by foreign engine supply delays? Is only the Indian Air Force affected by such dependency?

title: Culture Ministry to host Yoga Day celebrations at 100 iconic destinations, UNESCO heritage sites
content: These will complement the main celebrations, being hosted in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam that will led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Air India to cut 38 international flights per week; suspends services on 3 overseas routes
content: The objective is read restore schedule stability and minimise last-minute inconvenience to passengers

title: Fighting for space in Bengaluru’s core area
content: The tragic stampede outside the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium has brought the focus back on shifting the entities occupying large spaces in the city out. The Hindu listens to those who are for and against the idea

title: TTD adds RTC buses to its existing fleet of free buses
content: Devotees can board APSRTC buses from different points within Tirumala and motor down to Tirupati without paying any additional charges and appealed to the devout to make full use of the initiative.

title: Bike taxi drivers in Bengaluru demand legal recognition, cite threats and job loss
content: Representing platforms like Ola, Uber, and Rapido, the drivers submitted a petition demanding legal recognition and protection from harassment.

title: Uttarakhand: A hotbed for helicopter accidents
content: Fourteen crashes investigated till 2023, coupled with the spate of incidents in 2025, highlight a persistent aviation crisis

title: PM Modi likely to participate in photoshoot with foreign students on Yoga Day
content: At least 2,000 foreign students from over 50 countries are pursuing their UG, PG and  PhD courses in various institutions in Vizag

title: World Bank and ADB delegates attend CRDA’s orientation programme in Amaravati
content: They discuss the environmental and social safeguards, health and safety of workers, and other aspects related to capital city construction

title: Kashmir tourism likely to rebound to pre-Pahalgam levels by year’s end: Minister
content: The minister said, Kashmir is safe, and tourists should visit the valley. He appealed to the people of India to see Kashmir’s heritage and its historical grandeur and divinity, along with its natural beauty

title: Two Air India international flights from Bengaluru cancelled
content: Air India cuts international flights on widebody aircraft by 15%, affecting Bengaluru-London and Bengaluru-San Francisco routes

title: A childhood snatched, a future denied in Telangana and A.P.
content: In Telangana and Andhra Pradesh, where economic growth runs ahead of social investment, young tribal girls are still being pushed into early marriage and motherhood. A two-decade-long study tracking childhoods across the region reveals how poverty, poor access to education and entrenched gender norms continue to shape futures. Even as some break the cycle through support and schooling, many others remain caught between policy promises and lived realities, find Lavpreet Kaur, K. Umashanker and Sumit Bhattacharjee

title: Opposition criticises Jammu and Kashmir government for ‘dragging its feet’ on quota revamp
content: J&K Government delays finalising reservation report, sparking opposition criticism and demands for transparency and fair representation

title: Rajnath to attend SCO Defence Ministers’ meeting in China
content: He will hold bilateral talks with Chinese Defence Minister Admiral Dong and Russian counterpart Andrey Belousov on the sidelines of the conference; Meeting with Pak. Defence Minister unlikely

title: Helicopter accidents in Uttarakhand | The flight to see god
content: Five accidents in 40 days, including two fatal ones in which 13 people have lost their lives, have raised alarm bells on the chopper services plying during the Char Dham Yatra in the State. The Hindu finds that accidents, however, fail to deter thousands of pilgrims, who feel these flights are shortcuts to the abode of their gods

title: In Rajasthan, Pradhan credits NEP for India’s jump in global university rankings
content: Mr. Pradhan addressed the ninth convocation ceremony of the Central University of Rajasthan at Ajmer district’s Kishangarh and participated in a programme at Manipal University on the outskirts of Jaipur

title: Residents battered by sea erosion in Chellanam seek compensation
content: At least 15 houses were completely destroyed, and around 100 others remain uninhabitable, while many toilets have become unusable after septic tanks were clogged with silt by receding waves, says forum convenor; affected families have begun submitting applications for compensation

title: Spike in faecal contamination levels in Kadambrayar
content: Pollution in Kadambrayar caused by domestic effluent discharge from townships and households, says report submitted to NGT

title: CII lays road map to enhance Karnataka’s competitiveness in global market
content: Ease of doing business, sunrise sectors, capacity building for MSMEs, and growing beyond Bengaluru will be the focus areas of CII Karnataka during 2025-26

title: Madras High Court directs DGP to ensure names of sexual offence victims do not find place even in FIR
content: Justice P. Velmurugan orders that the identity of the victims should not be revealed in any form and police should maintain strict confidentiality

title: DMK-AIADMK spat highlights need for fair price to mango farmers in Tamil Nadu
content: Tamil Nadu is considered a major mango-growing State in India. The State government is urged to come up with a strategy for all perishable fruits and vegetables on measures to be taken to absorb the surplus.

title: Goa Medical College advisory board to have experts from AIIMS, WHO, says State Health Minister
content: The board will also decide the standard operating procedures for specialised treatments in the hospital, Vishwajit Rane said

title: BBMP to remove concrete around base of trees to prevent treefall in Bengaluru
content: As per the National Green Tribunal, the concrete, pavers or blocks installed in a one-metre radius of trees should be removed

title: Karnataka High Court orders release of Ningappa, prime accused in extortion case on interim bail citing procedural lapses in his arrest
content: In a petition filed by Ningappa’s wife, it was pointed out that the Lokayukta police had failed to produce him before the jurisdictional magistrate within 24 hours of his arrest

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau yet to decide where black box data will be decoded
content: Preliminary probe report on Air India Boeing 787-8 crash expected, says official; Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau in April inaugurated a new Digital Flight Data Recorder and Cockpit Voice Recorder lab at its headquarters

title: Political parties compete to take credit for resumption of MGNREGS in West Bengal
content: Court order a ‘significant victory for rural workers and a strong reaffirmation of their right to work under MGNREGA’, says agricultural workers’ union

title: India seeking trade deals with rich, democratic countries: Goyal
content: The government is focused on entering into robust trade agreements with the developed world, he says.

title: In U.K., Goyal slams Opposition for criticising Indian government overseas
content: The Minister commends the U.K. Labour Party for not backtracking on any commitments regarding the trade deal made to the Indian side by the previous Conservative Party government.

title: Congress sets up five-member panel to probe alleged rise in crimes against women in BJP-ruled Odisha
content: The move follows a gang rape incident in Gopalpur, where a college girl was attacked by a group of 10 men while she was at the beach during the Raj Parv festival

title: SWR saves ₹4 cr. by generating 6.72 million units of power harnessing solar energy
content: According to officials, this aligns with Indian Railways’ mission to become the world’s first 100% green railway network by 2030

title: ASI to host three-day international conclave in August on decoding Indus Valley script
content: Move comes months after Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Stalin announced $1 million prize for experts or organisations that succeed in deciphering the script

title: Maharashtra to establish Shahir Sable research centre for experimental arts
content: The centre will be named after the legendary Marathi folk artist Shahir Krishnarao Sable, renowned for his iconic song Jai Jai Maharashtra Majha — officially recognised as the state song in 2023.

title: Sun TV share dispute: DMK MP Dayanidhi Maran sends legal notice to brother Kalanithi Maran
content: The notice pointed that from the inception of Sun TV Network Ltd (earlier Sumangali Publications Pvt Ltd) till September 15, 2003, Mr. Kalanithi had served solely as an employee of the group receiving salary and did not hold any shares

title: Footwear hurled at West Bengal BJP president, Sikhs protests outside party office
content: A few days ago, the BJP leader had hurled a poster with a pair of slippers printed on it, which fell on a turban-clad police officer

title: BJP accuses Trinamool of ‘booth jam, rigging’ in Kaliganj bypoll; voting continues amidst rain
content: Bye-election in Kaliganj was necessitated after the passing of Trinamool Congress MLA Nasiruddin Ahmed on February 2. As of 5 p.m., EC officials pegged the turnout at nearly 70%

title: Raja Raghuvanshi murder: Police custody for slain Indore man’s wife extended
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi and her alleged lover Raj Singh Kushwaha are accused of murdering Sonam’s husband near a cascade in Meghalaya’s Sohra on May 23

title: BCI hits back at Society of Indian Law Firms over foreign law firm rules
content: Responding to SILF’s public statements on allowing foreign law firms to work in India, the BCI — the regulatory authority for the legal profession — said the group does not speak for most Indian law firms, especially smaller and newer ones

title: A novel that captures the reconversion of Catholic fishermen to Hinduism
content: It is rare to see a temple in front of a church, especially in Tamil Nadu’s southern coast where the entire fishermen community converted to Catholicism centuries ago. The Siddhi Vinayagar Temple at Idinthakarai in Tirunelveli district is the result of a tumultuous history, which is vividly told in the novel Alaivaikaraiyil by Rajam Krishnan

title: Canada-based Khalistani extremists continue to plan, fund violence in India, says report
content: A day after Modi-Carney reset ties, official Canadian government report doubles down on Nijjar killing allegations

title: Political fallout that unfolded after the brutal killing of EPRLF leaders
content: The massacre of K. Padmanabha and others in Chennai in 1990 paved the way for the Karunanidhi government to be dismissed. It also delivered a body blow to EPRLF, which was the main opponent of the LTTE. EPRLF is now a political party in Sri Lanka

title: Three missing after boat sinks in Assam
content: More than 100 people, including schoolchildren, were on the motorised boat that sank partially in a tributary of the Brahmaputra in the Nalbari district

title: NFL execs, scouts pick their favorite offseason moves: Where Rodgers, Pickens rate
content: twenty-eight teams are officially off for the summer, with the frenzied nature of transactions fading into the background . this week's minicamp is the ideal time to take stock of the splash moves around the league . a few potential moves remain on the radar, including a potential Jalen Ramsey trade .

title: Ranking the 10 most unbreakable records in college football
content: college football has evolved greatly over the years, but there are some records and accomplishments that have stood the test of time . we've examined the past 75 years in college football, tracing back to the 1950 season, and have ranked the 10 most "unbreakable" records in the sport, listing them in order of least likely to be topped.

title: Is the Club World Cup important? Yes, just ask the South American teams
content: Boca Juniors fans get ready for the club world cup with chants and drums on Miami beach . the tournament feels unmistakably South American, but in the u.s. it's a global tournament . many of their UEFA counterparts shrug with apathy at the expanded tournament, noting its lack of history .

title: Why the Panthers are the nicest 'rats' to win the Stanley Cup (twice)
content: the Florida Panthers defeat the Edmonton Oilers 5-1 to become back-to-back Stanley Cup champions . they're the most antagonistic trash-talking bullies in the national hockey league . opponents decry their actions and fans outright loathe them .

title: Euro 2025 team-by-team preview, predictions, key players, more
content: 16 nations will compete at euro 2025 in Switzerland for the chance to be crowned european champions . the stakes are higher than ever, with prize money more than doubled compared with the previous tournament . each federation receives at least €1.8 million and required to allocate at least 30% to players .

title: Five takeaways from J.J. McCarthy's offseason as Vikings' expected starting QB
content: the world has no shortage of opinions on quarterback J.J. McCarthy . he's not ready to lead the Vikings to super bowl lX in february . "they've really pushed the limits on just what I can handle," he says .

title: Recruiting intel from Elite 11 Finals and June's final official visit weekend
content: 20 of the nation's top high school quarterbacks convened in Southern California for the Elite 11 Finals . from Tuesday night to Thursday morning, 20 headliners convene in southern California . among the headliners are five-star passers in the 2026 ESPN 300 . a final round of official visits before the recruiting dead period from June 23 to July 31 .

title: Who has the best lineup in MLB? We ranked all 30 teams
content: a panel of our MLB experts ranks every team based on a combination of what we've seen so far and what we knew going into the season . the latest offensive shake-up came in the form of a blockbuster trade, with the Red Sox sending all-Star slugger Rafael Devers to the Giants .

title: 2025 NBA Finals: Pacers dominate at home in Game 6
content: the Pacers are able to force a game 7 of the NBA Finals . the Thunder were down 8-2 in the first game of the season . they missed their opening six shots, a streak that eventually grew to eight . a timeout was a precursor of an onslaught .
